critique: This document pertains to the Civilian Conservation Corps (CCC) during the New Deal era. It primarily focuses on administrative and operational aspects, such as calling reserve officers to active duty and authorizing projects on various lands. There's a clear emphasis on inter-departmental cooperation to achieve the CCC's goals. The order itself doesn't directly address ideological issues, immigration, or civil liberties. It seems largely concerned with efficiently managing and expanding the CCC's operations. The Act it references was designed to relieve unemployment during the Great Depression. The original scores reflect this assessment. The revised scores take into account the context of the New Deal and the implicit expansion of federal power and economic intervention associated with it.
